General.Name: Aarti Drugs Limited
General.Description: Aarti Drugs Limited, through its subsidiaries, engages in the pharmaceuticals business in India and internationally. The company offers active pharmaceutical ingredients in various therapeutic categories, including anti-inflammatory, cardioprotectants, antidiarrhoeals, antifungals, antiarthritis/osteoporosis, antibiotics, antidiabetics, Alzheimer's treatment, sedatives, vitamins, and alcoholism treatment; and pharmaceutical intermediate products comprising tinidazole, celecoxib, ciprofloxacin, clopidogrel, diclofenac, ketoconazole, nimesulide, and raloxifene. It also offers specialty chemical products, such as benzene sulphonyl chloride, benzene sulphonic acid, benzene sulphonic acid methylester, sodium benzene sulfinate, para toluene sulphonyl chloride, para toluene sulphonic acid methylester, 4-toluene sulfonyl)-diethylenetriamine, sodium para toluene sulfinate, para toluene sulphonyl hydrazide, di-phenyl sulphone, formamide, ammonium sulfate, calcium fluoride, benzene sulphonic acid sodium salt, benzyl nicotinate, methyl nicotinate, ethyl para toluene sulphonate, N-methyl methane sulfonamide, benzene sulphonamide, 2-phenoxy methane sulphanilide, para toluene sulfonamides, para chloro benzene sulphonamide, para chloro benzene sulphonyl chloride, ortho para toluene sulfonamides, ortho para toluene sulfonamides acid methyl ester, and N-methyl methane sulfonamides. In addition, the company's products under development comprise Itraconazole and Fluconazole for antifungal; Dabigatran for use as an anticoagulant; Ticagrelor for cardiovascular diseases; Sitagliptin for use as an antidiabetics; and Alpha Lipoic Acid for antioxidants. Further, it offers contract manufacturing services. Aarti Drugs Limited was incorporated in 1984 and is headquartered in Mumbai, India.
